channel.title: Linux
channel.description:
I am currently in the process of switching to linux (dual-booting). I have many reasons why:
Most people who have tryed it like it whylinuxisbetter.net My friend's dad is working on ubuntu so, i can get technical support I can keep Windows Why not?
I don't know... It just seems that everyone who has tryed it is very enthusiastic about it and it has many apps that make up for the ones it cant run... (eg. open office replaces MS office, GIMPshop replaces photoshop (which i don't own))
so, post you opinion and vote in the poll

item.title: Linux
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

If Directx was compatible on linux, then I'd swtich. I dont want to have to use emulators for everything, but maybe someday I'll install it on my old p2

Read full topic

Running on linux now... i still have to get wireless internet up... but, it is pretty cool so far

item.title: Linux
item.dc:creator: @d3ltr33 d3ltr33
item.description:
@d3ltr33 wrote:

The only reason i still have windows installed is because games are rarely ported to linux. And i love my games.

P.S. OpenOffice replaces MS office no matter what OS you're using.

Ubuntu is an awesome flavour. You'll love it.

Read full topic
